data.title: Flow is unknown in flow action after rename
data.body:
### Description

After renaming a flow that is used in the Flow action (enable or disable) the flow keeps its old name in the action but is now unknow.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. use the flow in the Flow action
2. rename the flow
3. go back to the Flow action, flow has still the old name.

**Expected behavior:** [What you expected to happen]

I expect the name of the flow altered anywhere where it is used in a flow.

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happened]

The flow name stays the same when used eg in the Flow action 
### Versions

0.8.22

data.title: Error On Opening New Atom Window
data.body:
Hi, 

I just started using atom... Yes, I have the latest version coz I just dloaded it... 
1. I already had opened a project. Then I went to Menu->Open or right clicked on the doc and tried to open a new atom window.
2. And it then gave me this error...

**Edit:**
Okay, I believe i have understood why it was happening, after I dloaded the zip file from atom.io, it extracted the Atom Application in my Downloads folder... I ran an instance of it, and then moved the Atom to Applications... And now since, the old Atom Window was not able to find the Atom Application in the old path, it started throwing an Exception... 

This might not really be a bug, but this should be handled in some other way I believe... 

Thanks Atom Developers for such a great and cool looking HACKABLE Editor... :)

Keep up the Great Work!!...

---

**Atom Version**: 1.5.4
**System**: Mac OS X 10.11
**Thrown From**: Atom Core
### Stack Trace

Uncaught Error: spawn /Users/squareboat/Downloads/Atom.app/Contents/Frameworks/Atom Helper.app/Contents/MacOS/Atom Helper ENOENT

data.title: Blank white screen on startup
data.body:
I've been using Atom 1.5.4 on Windows 10 for some time, and suddenly started getting a white blank screen on startup from time to time. Rebooting used to help, but no longer does. Upgrading to 1.6.0-beta8 didn't change anything. Running `atom -f --safe` printed:

> [7024:0310/134024:WARNING:accelerator_util.cc(118)] Invalid accelerator token: command
> [7024:0310/134024:WARNING:accelerator_util.cc(118)] Invalid accelerator token: command
> [7024:0310/134024:WARNING:accelerator_util.cc(118)] Invalid accelerator token: command
> [7024:0310/134024:WARNING:accelerator_util.cc(118)] Invalid accelerator token: command
> [3952:0310/134024:ERROR:renderer_main.cc(200)] Running without renderer sandbox
> [7024:0310/134026:INFO:CONSOLE(52)] "Window load time: 1047ms", source: file:///C:/Users/marci/AppData/Local/atom/app-1.6.0-beta8/resources/app.asar/static/index.js (52)
> [7024:0310/134026:INFO:CONSOLE(0)] "/deep/ combinator is deprecated. See https://www.chromestatus.com/features/6750456638341120 for more details.", source:  (0)

EDIT: Okay, it's no longer reproducible after another reboot. `atom -f --safe` prints the same.

data.title: Atom should provide a tabbed panel system
data.body:
Currently atom does not have a panel (tool window) layout manager ( ref docs https://atom.io/docs/api/v1.5.4/Panel ).

I use follow packages they all provide a panel:
- https://github.com/noseglid/atom-build by @noseglid.
- https://github.com/jeremyramin/terminal-plus by @jeremyramin
- And there is also build-in search package.

When they show up together, I got follow panels stacked and takes up too much space of my screen (Picture 1).

How about a panel layout manager like android studio does (Picture 2), make every panel has its proper place, the features include:
1. Stack panels in tabs.
2. Have at least left and right group of panel tabs (like android studio does in Picture 2).
3. Drag move for manually manage panel group.
4. Panel size, group ... should be saved across atom sessions.

Picture 1: Atom panels are not managed

![panels](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/20248/13658366/4a238d30-e6b1-11e5-8e3e-813b9feff3d1.png)

Picture 2: Android Studio panels are managed well

![android-studio-panels](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/20248/13658490/53a2976a-e6b2-11e5-9cd6-dfdc428ea39b.png)

data.title: Help>Roadmap menu option opens browser to a page that doesn't exists
data.body:
In the menu, if you navigate to Help>Roadmap it opens the browser to https://atom.io/roadmap?app which return a 404 page. 

I'm using Ubuntu but the issue is likely cross platform.

data.title: Atom freezes frequently when a network/UNC file is open on Windows
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging#update-to-the-latest-version)?
  - _Yes: Version 1.5.4 on Windows._
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging)?
  - _Yes, but I couldn't find how to profile Atom on startup. (I have a UNC/network file open in the project workspace, and every time I open Atom, it freezes before I can do anything.)_
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
  - _I skimmed it, but couldn't see anything relevant other than the debugging guide._
- [ ] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
  - _Probably not, but I didn't know which repository was most relevant._
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?
  - _Yes. I found some that sound similar, such as #2456 and #1766, but neither of them involve Atom completely freezing. They only report Atom performing poorly. In this case, Atom actually freezes/hangs. I've tried leaving it for multiple hours, only to find it still frozen._
### Description

When I leave a network/UNC file (e.g. "\host\share\folder\file") open, Atom eventually freezes. If I leave UNC file open in my project workspace, opening that project again results in Atom freezing as soon as I open it.

I am running Atom on Windows.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Open a network/UNC file in Atom.
2. Edit it and save the file. (Possibly not necessary.)
3. Leave Atom open for some time.
4. Return to Atom. Atom will likely have frozen.
   - Alternatively, close Atom and try re-opening the same Atom project later.

**Expected behavior:** Atom is responsive to user input.

**Actual behavior:** Atom is not responsive to user input. It is frozen/hung.

Please let me know if I can help profile or investigate this in some way.
### Versions

```
> atom --version

1.5.4

> apm --version
apm  1.6.0
npm  2.13.3
node 0.10.40
python
git 1.9.5.msysgit.0
visual studio 2013
```

data.title: Overlapping button and checkbox. OS X 10.11.3
data.body:
![error](http://cl.ly/2a003f1Z1T3j/error.png)

A "Hide Extension" check box is hidden underneath the new folder button.

I'm not sure if this is an Atom bug or an OS X bug. But I've only ever seen it in Atom. I'm not sure when it first appeared but I just noticed it today.

To reproduce, just right click the left sidebar and click "Add Project Folder".

OS X 10.11.3
Atom 1.5.4

data.title: Update nodegit
data.body: Fixes a crash when creating a diff. See https://github.com/nodegit/nodegit/pull/945.

data.title: Identical folders are opened as separate projects on case-insensitive filesystems
data.body:
### Description

On case-insensitive (but case-preserving) filesystems, opening a project by passing its folder to the `atom` command will not restore the project, if the path given has the wrong case.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Create a project in Atom with 1 folder (e.g. `~/Foo`).
2. Open some tabs in that project.
3. Close the window.
4. Reopen the project using the `atom` command with a name differing only in case (e.g. `atom ~/FOo`).

**Expected behavior:** Atom restores the previously open tabs for that project.

**Actual behavior:** Atom creates a brand-new project with the wrongly-cased root folder `CApe`, and does not restore the tabs from the original project.
### Versions

OS X.11 x86_64, Atom 1.5.4.

data.title: Startup window
data.body:
- I'm working with lot of small packages and opening each project takes a long time.
- wonder why not a startup window? much like LibreOffice or NetBeans.
- given the structure of Electron, why not an always running main process in the background like Chrome?

related: #2654

data.title: Default the options parameter to an empty object
Atom crashes when loading large binary file
data.body:
### Description

Atom crashes when loading large binary file
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Install Oracle Database 12c Enterprise Edition for Windows 64
2. After installation, open [OraHome]\cfgtoollogs\dbca\[dbname]\tempControl.ctl

**Expected behavior:**

Atom displays the content of the file.

**Actual behavior:** 

Atom crashes.
### Versions

Atom Version 1.5.4

[tempControl.zip](https://github.com/atom/atom/files/164777/tempControl.zip)

data.title: Mult-file multiple-line find (& replace)
data.body:
Enhance multiple-line find (& replace) to work for multiple files.

**Steps which explain the enhancement**
1. Press `meta-shift-f`
2. Enter your desired multiple-line find and replace values
3. Hit find (or replace/replace all) to complete the appropriate actions across all relevant files

**Current and suggested behavior**

Currently find (& replace) supports multiple-line entries in the currently open file, however no results will be returned if this is attempted for a multi-file search.

It would be very valuable to be able to do this... I find myself wishing this behavior was offered more than I would hope.

**Why would the enhancement be useful to most users**

Find & Replace is an invaluable tool in a multitude of scenarios, but one concrete example is when modifying multiple JSON files which contain the same, outdated schema.

If course this is only _one_ of _many_ possible use cases.

**Atom Version:** 1.5.4
**OS and Version:** All

data.title: Uncaught Error: spawn /Users/andrewprocter/Library/Application Support/com.github.atom.ShipIt/upd...

data.title: Uncaught TypeError: this.peekTop(...).setTarget is not a function
data.body:
[Enter steps to reproduce below:]

Unfortunately, it's rather hard to determine when it happens. But while working, it happens multiple times a day, usually just when navigating.
I know it's vague and may be hard to reproduce - if it's too much so, please feel free to close.
Also I will amend to this ticket in case I learn when exactly it happens.

**Atom Version**: 1.5.4
**System**: Mac OS X 10.11.3
**Thrown From**: Atom Core

Uncaught TypeError: this.peekTop(...).setTarget is not a function

data.title: View scroll issues with Atom 1.6.0-beta0+
data.body: ### Prerequisites - [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)? - [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging#update-to-the-latest-version)? - [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging)? - [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)? - [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)? - [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported? For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide. ### Description Functionality works in Atom 1.5 but not 1.6 beta. Cannot scroll within a React based plugin inside of Atom as of Atom 1.6.0-beta0 through the current beta7. Additionally, running ReactDOM on a target with `scrollIntoView()` results in strange behavior not found in Atom 1.5: This leads me to believe that the view is handled significantly differently in 1.6, and may have an effect on other plugins as well. ### Steps to Reproduce 1. apm install atom-coderoad 2. follow basic install directions 3. Run the app and complete an initial task. **Expected behavior:** Scrollable, no scroll target issues. **Actual behavior:** Not scrollable, scroll target effects workspace as well. ### Versions Issues occur with Atom 1.6-beta0 ~ 7. No problems in Atom 1.5.

data.title: Emit status changes when anything changes
data.body:
Fixes https://github.com/atom/status-bar/issues/128.

This mirrors the behavior of `GitRepository`.

data.title: Add zero to hexadecimal numbers below F (16)
data.body:
Should fix https://github.com/atom/settings-view/issues/712

The `numberToHexString` method incorrectly only put a 0 for numbers below 10 instead of 16, outputting `A` instead of `0A` for 11, for example. I've added a test at the only place that uses `toHexString` that fails on the current master branch. I'm not sure if it's in the right place, please let me know if I should move it/create seperate test cases.

data.title: Enter key is not working in SVG files
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [Y] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [Y] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [Y] Did you check the [debugging guide](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging)?
- [Y] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [Y] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [Y] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?
### Description

When you open an SVG file (or create a new one), you can't press <kbd>Enter</kbd> (Return) anywhere in the file. <kbd>Ctrl+Enter</kbd> works though, and I can normally type or change other characters.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Open any SVG file in Atom, or create a normal file and save as `.svg`
2. Try pressing Enter. Nothing happens.
3. Try pressing Ctrl+Enter. Newline is inserted in the next line.

**Expected behavior:** Newline should be inserted where the enter key is pressed.

**Actual behavior:** Nothing happens.
### Versions

1.5.4

data.title: Make atom.sh work in Cygwin
data.body:
Node cannot figure out to resolve atom.js while running though cygwin:

```
$ atom --wait .
module.js:340
    throw err;
          ^
Error: Cannot find module 'C:\cygdrive\c...'
```

But if we change current working directory to `$directory` then node will be able to resolve atom.js
